title: 113_hr5775
content: The "Powering American Jobs Act of 2014" is the short title of this Act, which primarily focuses on amending the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The table of contents for this Act is provided as well. The Act, titled "Powering American Jobs Act of 2014," focuses on amending the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It includes extensions and modifications for various energy-related credits and incentives. The "Powering American Jobs Act of 2014" amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 by extending and modifying energy-related credits and incentives. This includes updating Energy Star requirements for windows, doors, skylights, and roofing until December 31, 2015. The "Powering American Jobs Act of 2014" updates Energy Star requirements for windows, doors, skylights, and roofing to reduce heat gain in dwelling units. The standards for tankless and storage water heaters are updated to include specific energy efficiency requirements for different types of heaters. The updated standards for water heaters include specific energy efficiency requirements based on the type of heater, such as a minimum energy factor of 0.80 for heaters with a rated BTU input of no more than 75,000 BTU/hr, and a thermal efficiency of at least 90 percent for heaters with a higher BTU input. Additionally, electric heat pump storage water heaters must have an energy factor of at least 2.0 for water storage capacity equal to or less than 55 gallons, and 2.2 for capacity greater than 55 gallons. Other water heaters must have an energy factor of at least 0.90. The text discusses modifications to testing standards for biomass stoves and residential energy property expenditures. The amendment includes testing using the higher heating value of the fuel and following the Canadian Standards Administration B415.1 test protocol. Additionally, it defines qualified natural gas, propane, or oil furnaces or hot water boilers. The amendment defines qualified natural gas, propane, or oil furnaces and hot water boilers based on specific annual fuel utilization efficiency rates. The amendments made by this section apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2013. SEC. 3. Extension of excise tax credits for certain fuels placed in service after December 31, 2013. Extension of excise tax credits for biodiesel, renewable diesel fuel mixtures, and alternative fuels until December 31, 2015. Amendments made to various sections to extend the tax credits. Amendments were made to extend excise tax credits for biodiesel, renewable diesel fuel mixtures, and alternative fuels until December 31, 2015. Changes were made to sections regarding liquefied hydrogen and outlay payments for alternative fuels. Effective dates for the amendments were specified. The amendments apply to fuel sold or used after specific dates in 2013 and 2014. Special rules for biodiesel and alternative fuel credits during certain periods in 2014 are outlined. The Secretary of the Treasury will provide guidance for submitting one-time claims within 30 days of the enactment of the Act. Claims must be submitted within 180 days of the guidance issuance and will be paid within 60 days. Unpaid claims will accrue interest. SEC. 4. Extension of credit for alternative fuel vehicle refueling property to apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2015. SEC. 5. Extension of incentives for biodiesel and renewable diesel to apply to fuel sold or used after December 31, 2013. SEC. 6. Equalization of excise tax on liquefied natural gas and liquefied petroleum gas. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a tax rate of 18.3 cents per energy equivalent of a gallon of gasoline for liquefied petroleum gas. The tax rate for liquefied natural gas is 24.3 cents per energy equivalent of a gallon of diesel. The tax rate for liquefied natural gas is 24.3 cents per energy equivalent of a gallon of diesel, with specific Btu content requirements. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code define the energy equivalent of a gallon of diesel for liquefied natural gas fuel. The amendments made by this section apply to any sale or use of fuel after September 30, 2014.
